episode_summary: This episode covers a variety of intriguing topics, including the deadly plants at the Poison Gardens of Alnwick Castle, the fictional Oscar-nominated editor Roderick Jaynes, the unique architecture of ancient Turkish houses, and the fascinating defense mechanism of the red triangle slug.

facts.fact: Some of the plants at the Poison Gardens at Alnwick Castle are so deadly they are kept in cages.
The man who got nominated for an Oscar for editing 'No Country for Old Men' doesn't exist.
Houses in ancient Turkey had no doors or windows; you got in by climbing a ladder up to the roof and dropping through a trap door.
The red triangle slug can escape from frogs by supergluing them to trees.
